page.title: 15FLORA AND FAUNA, HOLBERROW
page.content:
To illustrate the interesting natural history of this area, some details follow regarding flora and fauna to be found. The findings are focused on the Nature Reserve and the area around Morton Underhill. The list includes some trees used domestically around the farm.
Hedgerow planted damsons, cider apples and perry pears exist following an old Worcestershire practice to give a crop from the hedgerow which would otherwise be an unproductive part of the farm. Willows growing around the farm are coppiced and when of a useful size used as hedging stakes and firewood. Examples are Acacia, Apple, Cedar of Lebanon, Dogwood, Elm, Holly, Ivy, Maple, Plum, Oak, Hazel, Elderberry, Hawthorn, Chestnut, Cherry Laurel, Blackberry, Ash.
